Data: Lee to Tamim, no run Lee slants the ball across the left-hander from over the wicket and bends it back in a little, the batsman defends
Lee to Tamim, no run Tamim plays the good length ball with a straight bat towards mid-on
Lee to Tamim, 1 run length ball with width outside off, Tamim gets going with a firm punch off the front foot through extra cover

Lee to Imrul, 4 byes that's beaten both batsman and wicketkeeper. Lee sprays it wide outside off, Kayes' eyes light up at the width on offer and he goes after it with a mighty swing, the ball swings away and beats the bat, it swings away from Haddin and beats him
Lee to Imrul, no run defended on the off side
Lee to Imrul, no run length ball outside off stump, Kayes strides forward and punches towards mid-off
Johnson to Tamim, no run that one didn't carry, Tamim let it go outside off and the ball bounced a second time before reaching Haddin, who hasn't had the easiest of starts today
Johnson to Tamim, no run good length outside off stump, Tamim moves forward and defends with a straight bat towards the off side

Johnson to Tamim, FOUR runs shorter length with lots of width outside off, Tamim stands in his crease, arches back a touch and drives the ball in front of point through the gap in the in-field. The timing is superb

Johnson to Tamim, OUT stunningly caught at first slip! The ball was pretty ordinary, on a length wide outside off, Tamim went after it, driving with power. He didn't make proper contact though and the thick outside edge flew at furious pace towards the left of Wats
Johnson to Nafees, 1 run he strides forward and opens the face to guide the ball to third man
Johnson to Imrul, 1 run a bit too straight and Kayes uses the angle into him to work the ball off his pads behind square

Lee to Imrul, no run huge appeal that carried on for ages! And with good reason. Lee banged in the bouncer and it is supremely directed. Kayes fended at it at first but then tried to pull his bat out of the way. He was late in doing so and he definitely gloved it t
Lee to Imrul, no run Kayes has a wild thrash at a delivery outside off and misses
Lee to Imrul, no run short of a length outside off, Kayes stays in his crease and lets it go
Lee to Imrul, no run good length but a touch wide outside off, Kayes moves forward and drives to cover
Lee to Imrul, no run that's an excellent delivery, pitches on a good length in line with off and deviates slightly to beat the forward prod of the batsman. Played down the wrong line.
Lee to Imrul, no run flicked off the pads to the fielder at square leg
Johnson to Nafees, FOUR runs a touch too full from Johnson and Nafees gets on to the front foot and drives the ball past the fielder at cover. It's four once it gets through the infield
Johnson to Nafees, 1 run played off the back foot to third man
Johnson to Imrul, no run Johnson tries the yorker but doesn't get the line quite right, Kayes gets hit on the pad after missing the flick
Johnson to Imrul, no run short of a length and straight, Kayes gets behind the line and defends with a straight bat
Johnson to Imrul, no run short ball and very straight, Kayes takes one hand off the bat as he defends from his crease
Johnson to Imrul, no run good length on off stump, Kayes gets behind the line on the front foot and blocks
Lee to Nafees, 1 run full and wide outside off and Nafees slashes hard at the ball, slicing it in the air towards third man where it bounces a few metres short of the fielder
Lee to Imrul, no run slower ball on off stump but Kayes spotted it, moving forward and driving crisply towards mid-off
Lee to Imrul, no run good length outside off and quicker, pushed off the front foot to the man at short cover
Lee to Imrul, no run short of a length delivery, Kayes stands tall on the back foot and plays it down on the pitch
Lee to Imrul, no run fuller ball from round the wicket, angling into the left-hander, Kayes drives towards cover
Lee to Imrul, no run length delivery outside off stump, Kayes moves forward and drives on the up to mid-off. Lee's conceded just one run in his last two overs.
Hastings to Nafees, no run short of a length angling across the left-hander, he has a swish and misses
Hastings to Nafees, no run Nafees has another go at a delivery that slants across him, gets beaten by the slightly higher bounce
Hastings to Nafees, no run this time he moves across his crease, covers his off stump, and lets the ball go through to Haddin
Hastings to Nafees, no run another delivery angling across the left-hander from over the wicket, another delivery left alone
Hastings to Nafees, 1 run Nafees strides forward and opens the face to guide the ball towards third man
Hastings to Imrul, no run good length outside off stump, Kayes strides forward and defends towards the fielder at short cover
Lee to Nafees, no run Lee bowls another well-directed bouncer that catches Nafees on the crease, the batsman fends and the ball hits glove and lobs safely on the pitch
Lee to Nafees, 1 run short of a length delivery on leg and middle, Nafees tucks the ball behind square
Lee to Imrul, no run good length and the line is just outside off stump, Kayes moves back and lifts his bat out of the way
Lee to Imrul, no run another short ball just outside off, Kayes drops his wrists and lets it pass. We haven't seen a hook or pull today. Plenty of short balls on offer.
Lee to Imrul, no run fuller ball outside off, driven into the ground towards the man at short cover
Lee to Imrul, no run driven off the front foot towards Hussey at short cover once again. Kayes is now 1 off 24 balls. He has to make this count now.
Hastings to Nafees, no run defended off the back foot towards point, Hastings hits the pitch hard and bowls a heavy sort of ball
Hastings to Nafees, 1 run straighter line on middle stump, Nafees dabs the ball towards midwicket and calls for a quick single
Hastings to Imrul, no run good length and straight, defended on the front foot
Hastings to Imrul, no run another dot ball from Kayes, defended on the front foot towards Hastings. He's got to look to rotate strike at least.
Hastings to Imrul, no run Kayes has width outside off and he makes good contact with the cut, he doesn't beat point though. He will be feeling this mounting pressure.
Hastings to Imrul, 1 run Kayes keeps strike by opening the face as he drives to steer the ball to third man
Lee to Imrul, no run good length and very straight, defended back to the bowler
Lee to Imrul, no run defended on the front foot towards the off, Lee has a polite chat with the batsman, probably asking him to get it off the square
Lee to Imrul, no run Lee fires in a bouncer, Kayes ducks under it
Lee to Imrul, no run Kayes jumps towards leg and tries to flay a full ball from round the wicket through the off side, Kayes misses
Lee to Imrul, no run Lee doesn't give Kayes any width by angling it in from round the wicket on a good length, Kayes defends on the front foot
Lee to Imrul, no run shouts of catch it as Kayes drives a length ball on the up towards mid-off, it falls a few feet in front of the fielder. Kayes plays out another maiden
Hastings to Nafees, 1 run Nafees nudges the ball through square for a single, will he have to watch the rest of the over from the non-striker's end?

Hastings to Imrul, 1 run well done Kayes! He drops the ball with soft hands on the off side and looks at Nafees, who's charging down for the single. Hastings tried to get to the ball and got in the way of the non-striker. Hussey from cover would have run out Nafees
Hastings to Nafees, no run beaten outside the off stump
Hastings to Nafees, no run played on the leg side
Hastings to Nafees, 1 run a slower ball and Nafees plays the ball through square leg
Hastings to Imrul, 1 run Kayes keeps strike by guiding a wide ball towards third man.
Johnson to Imrul, 1 run short of a length outside off, Kayes stands tall on the back foot and drives through cover

Johnson to Nafees, 1 run terrific effort on the third man boundary. Nafees slashes a short and wide ball towards third man where Hastings runs to his left and dives to intercept the racing ball. Ponting runs from point to give Hastings a pat
Johnson to Imrul, no run played to cover on the front foot
Johnson to Imrul, no run Kayes moves forward and defends a good length ball on the leg side
Johnson to Imrul, no run another good length delivery on off and middle, Kayes gets behind it and blocks, like he's done most of today

Johnson to Imrul, OUT and his misery is over and this sets Bangladesh back. It was a short ball and Kayes attempted the first pull of the day. He tried to hit it from way way outside off though. It didn't come off and the top-edge flew high in the air towards the
Hastings to Nafees, 1 run played off the pads through square leg
Hastings to Raqibul, no run left alone outside off stump
Hastings to Raqibul, no run short ball and Hasan sways slightly and lets it go through to Haddin

Hastings to Raqibul, OUT bowled him. Bangladesh continue to sink. Hastings hits the pitch short of a length and seams the ball away from the right-hander after pitching around off and middle. Raqibul tries to defend but plays down the wrong line. The ball clips th
Hastings to Shakib, no run defended on the off side off the back foot
Hastings to Shakib, FOUR runs full ball outside off and Shakib moves forward and plays a fluent drive through cover, he's batting too low in this line-up

Johnson to Nafees, FOUR runs there's no slip! Nafees pushes forward at a delivery that angles into him and he edges it through the vacant cordon. He wanted to play to third man but ended up edging it much finer than intended
Johnson to Nafees, no run Nafees moves forward and across and closes the face of the bat to play on the leg side
Johnson to Nafees, no run Nafees takes one hand off the bat and plays towards point
Johnson to Nafees, no run tries to drive but ends up mis-timing it on the leg side
Johnson to Nafees, no run well-directed short ball and Nafees does well to drop his wrists and sway out of the way
Johnson to Nafees, no run short and wide outside off, Nafees tries to cut without moving feet and gets beaten
Watson to Shakib, no run angles a short of a length delivery into the left-hander, Shakib plays it from the crease on the leg side
Watson to Shakib, no run Watson keeps a good length around off, Shakib stays in his crease and plays towards midwicket
Watson to Shakib, no run fuller length outside off, Shakib stays on the back foot and drives to mid-off
Watson to Shakib, no run Watson's taking lots of pace off the ball, driven off the front foot to mid-off
Watson to Shakib, 1 run pushed in front of point for a single
Watson to Nafees, 1 run moves forward and pushes a length ball through cover point for one more
Johnson to Nafees, FOUR runs short and wide outside off, Nafees goes after it, cutting it in the air over point, finding the gap between third man and the fielder on the sweeper boundary
Johnson to Nafees, 1 run driven off the front foot towards extra cover
Johnson to Shakib, no run fuller length and straight, Shakib drives towards the bowler
Johnson to Shakib, no run short of a length on off stump, Shakib defends on the back foot
Johnson to Shakib, no run a full ball nearly in the blockhole, Shakib digs it out towards point
Johnson to Shakib, no run good length on off and middle, Shakib defends from the crease towards the leg side
Watson to Nafees, 2 runs Nafees moves forward and towards the line of the ball outside off before opening the face to steer to third man
Watson to Nafees, no run he leans forward towards the off this time and defends on the leg side, Watson went wide of the crease to angle the ball into the left-hander
Watson to Nafees, no run defended confidently towards the off side on the front foot
Watson to Nafees, no run defended on the front foot towards cover once again
Watson to Nafees, no run defended on the off side, tight over so far
Watson to Nafees, no run Nafees ends the over by pushing the ball off his pads towards leg
Lee to Shakib, no run full ball just outside off, driven towards mid-off
Lee to Shakib, 1 run short of a length delivery outside off from round the wicket, Shakib hits it off the back foot through cover
Lee to Nafees, no run Lee angles a full ball into the left-hander, Nafees moves forward and plays towards midwicket
Lee to Nafees, no run good length ball that cramps the left-hander for room with the angle from round the wicket, defended on the off side

Lee to Nafees, 1 run short of a length and wide outside off, Nafees mis-times the drive away from his body and just as well for him for it fell short of the fielder at deep cover. It might have gone straight to hand had he hit it better
Lee to Shakib, no run defended from the crease towards the off side
Watson to Nafees, 1 run good length ball outside off, driven off the front foot through cover
Watson to Shakib, no run Watson angles the ball into off and middle from wide of the crease, Shakib plays the ball to midwicket
Watson to Shakib, no run Shakib punches off the front foot but can't beat the fielder at short cover
Watson to Shakib, no run short of a length slightly wider outside off, Shakib cuts but hits it into the ground towards point
Watson to Shakib, no run that's not short enough to pull but the growing pressure makes Shakib attempt it anyway, he makes decent contact but the shot is intercepted by the fielder at midwicket
Watson to Shakib, no run played back to the bowler this time
Lee to Nafees, no run Lee pitches short, angling the ball across the left-hander from over the wicket, Nafees stands tall and tries to cut but bottom edges it into the ground near his feet
Lee to Nafees, no run another short ball which is straighter, Nafees tries to turn it on the leg side but gets a leading edge that drops safely in front of him
Lee to Nafees, FOUR runs that's cut and cut superbly. Not that wide outside off and Nafees cracks it past point and too wide of the fielder at third man. Bangladesh finally go past 50.
Lee to Nafees, 1 run played off the pads through midwicket
Lee to Shakib, 1 run short ball and Shakib pulls the ball through square, a soft pull though, rolled his wrists and kept it down
Lee to Nafees, 1 run glanced off the pads towards fine leg, Lee's line was a bit too straight
Watson to Nafees, no run a slow Watson delivery beats Nafees and hits him on the pad, Watson begins to appeal but that was missing leg as it was delivered from very wide of the crease
Watson to Nafees, 1 run steered with an open face towards third man
Watson to Shakib, 1 run that's short on leg stump, Shakib swivels and pulls towards Lee on the fine-leg boundary
Watson to Nafees, no run another short ball into the body, played down on the leg side

Watson to Nafees, FOUR runs full ball on the pads, Nafees lifts it over the fielder at midwicket and places it well enough to beat the man on the boundary. He didn't try to hit it too hard, just chipped it and placed it well
Watson to Nafees, 1 run played off the pads once again behind square
Smith to Nafees, 1 run driven off the front foot to the man on the long-off boundary
Smith to Shakib, 1 run tossed up wide outside off stump, slapped off the front foot to long off once again
Smith to Nafees, no run driven firmly off the front foot but Smith leaps to his left and cuts it off
Smith to Nafees, 1 run pushed off the front foot towards point

Smith to Shakib, OUT bowled him! Smith flights the ball across the left-hander, drawing Shakib into the front-foot drive, the ball pitches and spins back into the batsman, finding the gap between bat and pad to hit the stumps
Smith to Mushfiqur, 1 run Rahim makes a bit of room and drives inside out through cover
Doherty to Mushfiqur, no run he pitches around off and spins the ball past the outside edge of Rahim's push from the crease
Doherty to Mushfiqur, no run Rahim cuts off the back foot to point
Doherty to Mushfiqur, no run he drives, off the front foot third time to cover
Doherty to Mushfiqur, 1 run fuller ball and Mushfiqur finds the gap with the cover drive
Doherty to Nafees, no run played off the pads towards square leg
Doherty to Nafees, no run over the wicket to the left-hander, Nafees plays off his pads once again
Lee to Shuvo, 1 run played towards square leg, Mushfiqur is struggling with his running, it's a hot day in Mirpur
Lee to Mushfiqur, 1 run a short ball and Mushfiqur swats it through midwicket, that was a slower short ball
Lee to Shuvo, no run Lee bowls a yorker, and Shuvo's attempted drive finishes as a dig back to the bowler
Lee to Shuvo, 1 run Shuvo moves towards leg to make room but Lee follows and cramps him. Played towards midwicket for one
Lee to Mushfiqur, no run the slower short ball beats Mushfiqur's attempted heave over midwicket. Mushfiqur looks exhausted
Lee to Mushfiqur, FOUR runs shot! Full and straight, Mushfiqur stands in his crease and gives the ball a powerful thump that beats mid-off and runs to the boundary
Johnson to Shuvo, FOUR runs deft shot! Shuvo backs away towards leg to make room and then dabs the ball fine past Haddin for four, the length was too short from Johnson
Johnson to Shuvo, OUT caught at cover! Shuvo backs away to a length delivery and tries to slap it over the infield, he doesn't get enough elevation and Smith takes the catch above his head
Johnson to Shafiul, no run a wild slog from Shafiul, aiming for down the ground, gets beaten outside off. Take a single and get off strike!

Johnson to Shafiul, FOUR runs or that! Shafiul prods at one that slants across him from round the wicket and edges it, the ball falls short of first slip and the bounce beats the fielder and Bangladesh get four to third man
Johnson to Shafiul, no run played from the crease towards Ponting to point

Johnson to Shafiul, 2 runs Shafiul clears his front foot out of the way and thrashes at the ball. Where he was aiming for, I can't be certain. He ended up slicing it towards Lee who fumbled on the backward point boundary to allow the second. I never thought they'd
Smith to Mushfiqur, 2 runs a bit too short and Mushfiqur is quick to go on the back foot and cut through the gap between backward point and short third man
Smith to Mushfiqur, no run played off the front foot towards point
Smith to Mushfiqur, 1 run flighted delivery on middle stump, Mushfiqur makes a bit of room and drives fluently through wide mid-off
Smith to Nafees, no run driven back to the bowler and Smith dives to his left to field
Smith to Nafees, no run Nafees strides forward and defends
Smith to Nafees, 1 run that's a long hop which keeps rather low, Nafees goes back and pulls along the ground through midwicket
Doherty to Nafees, no run driven off the front foot towards mid-off
Doherty to Nafees, 1 run a bit too close to off stump to cut but Nafees manages to get it away to deep point
Doherty to Mushfiqur, no run tossed up outside off, pushed on the off side off the front foot
Doherty to Mushfiqur, no run defended with a straight bat towards the bowler
Doherty to Mushfiqur, 1 run a bit of width outside off and Mushfiqur drives through cover point
Doherty to Nafees, 1 run Doherty spins the ball into the pads and Nafees work the ball towards fine leg
Lee to Mushfiqur, (no ball) that's a high full toss, a no-ball for height, and Mushfiqur was taken by surprise and mis-timed the shot on the leg side
Lee to Mushfiqur, 1 run a low full toss, attempted yorker, Mushfiqur makes room and drives towards cover
Lee to Shafiul, 1 run another low full toss outside off, Shafiul plays the ball towards cover point for another single
Lee to Mushfiqur, no run short ball and Mushfiqur was in no position to play it, he had to duck and avoid it in the end
Lee to Mushfiqur, FOUR runs well done Mushfiqur! He backed away towards leg to create room, Lee followed him with a short ball, Mushfiqur adjusted his shot and chipped it over the keeper for four

Lee to Mushfiqur, SIX runs it's been a long time coming! Length ball from Lee, Mushfiqur clears his front foot out of the way and slams it over deep midwicket, Mirpur roars as the ball sails into the stands
Lee to Mushfiqur, FOUR runs expensive end from Lee, full of leg stump, Mushfiqur glances the ball off his pads between the keeper and the fielder at short fine leg
Johnson to Shafiul, 1 run Shafiul clears his front foot and biffs a length ball towards wide mid-off to give Mushfiqur the strike
Johnson to Mushfiqur, FOUR runs he's on fire is little Mushfiqur! Length ball outside off stump, the batsman lines it up and slaps it in the air and just out of reach of the leaping fielder at cover
Johnson to Mushfiqur, no run a slower ball from Johnson and Mushfiqur gets beaten by the change of pace, he tried to heave that over midwicket

Johnson to Mushfiqur, FOUR runs length again from Johnson and Mushfiqur has smashed it over midwicket. He picked it up early and hit it very high over midwicket. That looked to have just cleared the boundary but it's been given four. Will have to check replays.
Johnson to Mushfiqur, 1 run mis-hit towards midwicket for a single
Johnson to Shafiul, 1 run Shafiul backs away and plays the ball to cover for one
I'll be back at 1345 for the chase. Australia face a trial by spin on a pitch that is slow and turning.
"This is the danger of having a star-studded bowling line-up, teams throw the kitchen sink at anything down the stretch. Kudos to Bangla though, given a nice target," says Jonesy.
"Mushfiqur Rahim take a bow, its been splendid watching him play in this team, after Bangladesh seemed destined to not even reach 150, truly remarkable," says James.

1310 Little Mushfiqur Rahim has given Bangladesh a terrific finish to their innings. A target of 230 won't scare Australia but it's far more than what Bangladesh looked close to getting when Kayes was stuck in the thickest mire ever found on a cricket pitch.
Australia's chase of 230 is about to begin. Watson and Haddin to open as usual. Shafiul has the new ball, running in from over the wicket. Slip and short cover in place.
Shafiul to Watson, 1 wide starts with a wide ball outside off stump, was just inside the tram line I think but the umpire is harsher than I am
Shafiul to Watson, FOUR runs short, wide and smashed. Too much room from Shafiul and poor length, Watson cuts with power through point
Shafiul to Watson, no run good length and closer to off stump, Watson moves forward and shoulders arms
Shafiul to Watson, FOUR runs length ball outside off, Watson strides forward and plays a muscular drive past the short cover fielder and wide of the man at mid-off
Shafiul to Watson, FOUR runs too full and straight, Watson barely moves before bringing his bat down straight and driving the ball between the bowler and mid-on, Shafiul copping a hammering
Shafiul to Watson, no run driven off the front foot into the ground and towards the bowler
Shafiul to Watson, 1 run short and wide outside off again, Watson cuts into the ground and over backward point towards third man
Razzak to Watson, no run defended on the front foot towards the bowler
Razzak to Watson, no run Watson goes back and plays towards the bowler
Razzak to Watson, no run good length and very straight, driven back to the bowler once again
Razzak to Watson, no run Watson closes the face to play on the leg side but misses and gets hit on the pad, Razzak appeals but that was missing leg

Razzak to Watson, FOUR runs that's too short and what a shot that is! Watson clears his front foot out of the way and pulls the ball hard and straight past the bowler. All the finesse of a wrecking ball but it got the job done.
Razzak to Watson, 1 run played towards deep midwicket for a single
Shakib to Watson, no run the arm ball into the right-hander, Watson defends on the off side
Shakib to Watson, no run Watson gets down on one knee to sweep and gets an inside edge behind square when he was aiming for midwicket
Shakib to Watson, 2 runs played behind point for two more
Shakib to Watson, SIX runs Watson uses his long reach to lunge forward and heave the ball over deep midwicket, immense power, Australia are racing away and Haddin hasn't faced a ball!
Shakib to Watson, 1 run driven off the pads to deep midwicket, and Haddin has the strike
Shakib to Haddin, 1 run Haddin gets going smoothly with a clip off his pads through midwicket
Razzak to Haddin, no run Haddin misses the glance off the pads
Razzak to Haddin, no run defended on the front foot towards the leg side
Razzak to Haddin, no run Haddin moves forward and defends on the off
Razzak to Haddin, no run that's a bit too short and Haddin mis-times the back-foot cut towards cover point
Razzak to Haddin, no run tossed up on off and middle, Haddin defends on the front foot
Razzak to Haddin, 1 run Haddin is hogging the strike now, takes a single after five dots by playing the ball off his pads behind square
Shakib to Haddin, no run defended on the front foot towards the bowler
Shakib to Haddin, no run Haddin gets behind the line of a quick one and blocks on the leg side
Shakib to Haddin, no run played off the front foot towards midwicket
Shakib to Haddin, FOUR runs Haddin uses his feet to step out, gets to the pitch of the ball and lofts it through the line, over the fielder at mid-on
Shakib to Haddin, no run played back to the bowler
Shakib to Haddin, no run Haddin steps out again, realises he isn't to the pitch of the ball and pads it away
Razzak to Watson, no run that's fired down leg side and Watson misses the glance. Huge appeal for caught behind but the umpire is unmoved. No wide called so must have been pad.
Razzak to Watson, FOUR runs and Watson continues bullying the bowlers, waiting for the ball to angle into him before swinging with power through midwicket
Razzak to Watson, no run defended back to the bowler
Razzak to Watson, no run played off the back foot towards midwicket

Razzak to Watson, SIX runs What's Watson had for lunch? He clears his front foot out of the way to open his shoulders and create hitting space. And hit it he does, slamming the ball over deep midwicket with a slog sweep
Razzak to Watson, 1 run bowled flat on middle stump, played off the back foot through midwicket, Watson keeps strike now
Shakib to Watson, SIX runs that's short and Watson is hitting better balls than those. He hits this one as well, pulling it flat off the back foot over the deep square leg boundary
Shakib to Watson, no run fired in quick outside off, Watson aimed for another hit but then cut the ball into the ground towards slip

Shakib to Watson, SIX runs ok this is painful to watch now, Watson gets to fifty by heaving a short ball off the back foot over long-on, cleared it comfortably. Bangladesh had got to 50 in the 18th over.
Shakib to Watson, no run Watson misses the slog sweep, Bangladesh sigh in relief
Shakib to Watson, no run defended on the off side
Shakib to Watson, 1 run ah ha, Watson cleverly keeps strike by pushing the last ball towards wide mid-on
Razzak to Watson, 1 run full ball on middle stump, Watson is magnanimous and takes a single by driving to long-on
Razzak to Haddin, 2 runs Haddin uses the leg-stump line to glance the ball past short fine leg for two more
Razzak to Haddin, no run Haddin tries to hit over the top on the leg side but misses and gets hit on the pad
Razzak to Haddin, no run loud appeal for lbw after Haddin got squared up and beaten, he was hit on the pad. Looked close but perhaps missing leg.
Razzak to Haddin, no run defended on the leg side
Razzak to Haddin, no run Haddin moves back, gets behind the line, and defends
Shakib to Watson, no run Watson strides forward, but instead of unleashing hell on the bowlers in the direction of midwicket, he defends.
Shakib to Watson, 1 run played through the leg side for a single

Shakib to Haddin, OUT caught at midwicket. It's Robin, though, not Batman. Haddin charges and tries to hit over the leg side, he gets beaten in the flight and makes contact with the inner part of the bat. The bat turned on impact as well. The ball flies in the air
Shakib to Ponting, no run Ponting strides forward, gets behind the line and defends
Shakib to Ponting, no run Ponting lunges and defends with bat close to pad
Shakib to Ponting, no run Ponting goes back and punches off the back foot but Shakib moves to his right and stops the ball
Razzak to Watson, no run Watson tries to play the leg glance but makes poor contact
Razzak to Watson, no run Watson lunges forward and defends with a straight bat
Razzak to Watson, no run driven hard into the ground and towards the bowler
Razzak to Watson, no run the quicker ball on middle stump, Watson is waiting for the opportunity to hit but doesn't get it, he defends on the off side

Razzak to Watson, SIX runs well he's got it this time, short ball and that is simply too easy for Watson who once again shows off his pulling skills by heaving a long hop into the first tier at midwicket
Razzak to Watson, no run tries to play down to fine leg but misses and gets hit on the pad
Shakib to Ponting, no run Ponting moves forward and defends on the off side
Shakib to Ponting, no run Ponting lunges, like he usually does, and defends
Shakib to Ponting, no run played towards point off the front foot
Shakib to Ponting, no run tossed up slowly on off stump, defended on the off side
Shakib to Ponting, no run that's wide down leg side and Ponting should have done more with it than paddle to short fine leg. Watson would have hit it to Chittagong.
Shakib to Ponting, no run defended on the off side
Rubel to Watson, no run good length at skiddy pace around off stump, Watson defends on the front foot
Rubel to Watson, FOUR runs short and wide outside off stump, Watson moves forward and lays into it, swinging his bat heavily to cut the ball through point
Rubel to Watson, no run Watson drives the ball hard into the ground towards cover, he bats with such industrial power
Rubel to Watson, FOUR runs short and wide outside off stump, Watson slashes and goes hard at the ball, edging it in the air towards the third man boundary
Rubel to Watson, 1 run length ball outside off stump, the broad bat of Watson comes crashing down on the ball and sends it through cover point
Rubel to Ponting, 1 run Ponting gets off the mark by pushing off the front foot towards cover. He's made a Kayes-esque start.
Shuvo to Ponting, FOUR runs well that is a poor start to Ponting, a short ball down leg side, Ponting hit one of those to short fine leg earlier, this time he pulls it to the long leg boundary
Shuvo to Ponting, 1 run tossed up on middle and leg, flicked behind square for a single
Shuvo to Watson, 1 run punched off the back foot towards long on for a single
Shuvo to Ponting, 1 run Ponting moves forward, and then goes back to work the ball off his pads through square
Shuvo to Watson, 1 run tossed up on middle stump, Watson makes room and drives along the ground to long-on
Shuvo to Ponting, no run Ponting steps out and drives towards mid-on
Rubel to Watson, no run good length and straight, punched off the front foot towards mid-off
Rubel to Watson, FOUR runs that's a little short and Watson pulls, hitting the ball with the toe of the bat. Such is his power though that the ball races to the midwicket boundary
Rubel to Watson, no run good length outside off, Watson drives off the front foot to cover, smack out of the middle that was
Rubel to Watson, no run fuller length outside off, driven off the front foot towards mid-off

Rubel to Watson, (no ball) FOUR runs he can be delicate too! A high full toss on leg stump, and instead of smashing it to smithereens, Watson merely helps it around the corner, wide of the fielder at short fine leg
Rubel to Watson, 1 run a full ball nearly in the blockhole, dug out past the bowler for a single
Rubel to Ponting, no run Ponting moves forward and plays a fluent drive towards mid-on
Shuvo to Watson, FOUR runs too far down leg side, Watson gets down on one knee and sweeps the ball in the air and down to the vacant long-leg boundary
Shuvo to Watson, SIX runs this is brutal, Watson gets down low once again, and swings the hammer of Thor to bash to ball over deep square leg with the slog sweep, unbelievable striking
Shuvo to Watson, no run played back to the bowler
Shuvo to Watson, 1 run pushed off the front foot towards mid-on
Shuvo to Ponting, no run Ponting tries to pull a slower ball and gets into a tangle of sorts, he doesn't make contact
Shuvo to Ponting, no run short ball outside off but Ponting hits it off the back foot straight to the man at cover. What would Watson have done with that, I wonder?
Rubel to Watson, 1 run punched towards long-on off the back foot
Rubel to Ponting, no run played back to the bowler off the front foot
Rubel to Ponting, no run Ponting's timing his drives well but hitting it to fielders, this one goes off the front foot towards cover
Rubel to Ponting, 3 runs terrific shot, that was nearly a yorker but Ponting brought his bat down in time and punched the ball past the bowler. Less power, more timing.
Rubel to Watson, no run played from the crease towards point
Rubel to Watson, 1 run short and wide outside off, cut off the front foot to deep point to bring up the 50 partnership
Shakib to Watson, no run defended on the front foot
Shakib to Watson, no run pushed off the front foot back to the bowler, he's biding his time here
Shakib to Watson, no run he got into position to hit over midwicket but had to defend off the back foot because the ball was flat and fast
Shakib to Watson, 1 run played off the pads through midwicket for a single
Shakib to Ponting, no run Ponting moves down leg and then tries to sweep, trying to beat short fine leg, but doesn't
Shakib to Ponting, no run defended on the front foot towards the off
Rubel to Watson, 1 run 6 off two now, this one was a yorker on off stump, Watson dug it out on the off side for a single
Rubel to Ponting, no run Ponting moves forward and times the drive well, but straight to the bowler

Rubel to Ponting, SIX runs can't find gaps in the field, go over them! Ponting gets on to the front foot and swings his bat hard, hitting through the line of the ball and sending it over the wide long-on boundary
Rubel to Ponting, 1 run played to midwicket for a single
Rubel to Watson, 1 run a full ball with some swing into the right-hander, Watson flicks through square leg. He needs five off 1 ball to break Hayden's record. Five off 2 to equal it.
Rubel to Ponting, 1 run driven on the leg side for a single
Shakib to Ponting, 1 run Ponting drives to long-on for a single
Shakib to Watson, no run ah, Watson! Defends the ball back to the bowler to give up the chance of breaking Hayden's fastest hundred by an Australian
Shakib to Watson, 1 run driven off the back foot through cover
Shakib to Ponting, 1 run Ponting moves back and punches the ball towards long on
Shakib to Watson, 1 run Watson moves back, gets cramped for room, but still manages to punch the ball through wide mid-on

Shakib to Ponting, 2 runs Ponting steps out and moves towards leg to make room to hit inside out towards off, he gets a thick outside edge that flies through the gap between backward point and short third man
Shafiul to Watson, 2 runs Watson tries to drive but gets an inside edge behind square, he comes back for the second and moves on to 99

Shafiul to Watson, FOUR runs take a bow Shane Watson! He brings up ODI century No. 6 with a fluent drive of the front foot through extra cover, threading the gap between cover and mid-off. Terrific shot.

Shafiul to Watson, FOUR runs dropped. Watson goes big, lofting the ball high in the air towards long-on where Razzak runs back and tries to take the catch, he gets both hands to it but can't hold on, the ball pops out of his hands and falls just inside the boundar
Shafiul to Watson, 1 run full toss on middle and leg, Watson flicks the ball through midwicket
Shafiul to Ponting, 1 run Ponting drives a full ball towards long-on
Shafiul to Watson, 1 run the slower ball and Watson works it through midwicket
Razzak to Watson, FOUR runs Watson aims for the coruscating swing over midwicket but gets a thick edge that flies over the man at first slip for four
Razzak to Watson, 1 run hit in the air but falls well short of the man at long-on
Razzak to Ponting, 1 run Ponting nudges the ball towards long-on for a single

Razzak to Watson, 1 run dropped! Again! Watson finally mis-times a slog sweep high in the air towards deep midwicket, Raqibal Hasan runs to his right towards the ball, gets to it while he's on the move and then drops it. Not an easy chance but they must be taken i
Razzak to Ponting, no run played towards midwicket
Razzak to Ponting, 3 runs Ponting moves forward and then sweeps the ball behind square
Shuvo to Ponting, 1 run driven to long on for a single

Shuvo to Watson, SIX runs so we've seen this before. Watson down on one knee, waiting for the ball angling into him from the left-armer, swinging the bat with tremendous power and slamming the ball over deep midwicket
Shuvo to Watson, SIX runs Bangladesh are being battered and bullied, Watson gets down and then hammers it over the long-on boundary this time, he clears it by miles

Shuvo to Watson, SIX runs this is carnage, Bangladesh are defenceless, rubbish bowling though. Full toss on leg stump and Watson swings it over the deep backward square leg boundary. He's hit the most sixes by an Australian in an innings.
Shuvo to Watson, SIX runs this has gone too, Watson picks it up from outside off and heaves the ball over wide long-on, that went into the first tier
Shuvo to Watson, 2 runs Watson hammers the ball hard and straight but along the ground, giving the fielder at long off some work to do
Mahmudullah to Ponting, no run Ponting strides forward and defends on the off side, the whole world outside Bangladesh wants him to take a single
Mahmudullah to Ponting, 1 run played to long-on for a single
Mahmudullah to Watson, 1 run Watson heaves again, this time along the ground to deep midwicket
Mahmudullah to Ponting, no run Ponting moves back and plays the ball on the leg side
Mahmudullah to Ponting, 1 run driven to long-on for a single
Mahmudullah to Watson, SIX runs Gulp. Watson sees a short ball, and pulls again, giving it plenty of air time as it makes the journey from pitch to stand beyond wide long-on
Rubel to Ponting, 1 run driven off the front foot through cover
Rubel to Watson, 2 runs Watson aims for down the ground and unbelievably it doesn't come off. He slices it in the air over point to bring up his 150
Rubel to Watson, 1 run Watson plonks that heavy foot forward and drills the ball down the ground to long off
Rubel to Ponting, 1 run driven fluently off the front foot through cover, Ponting letting Watson do all the hard work!
Rubel to Watson, no run a yorker, and for once Watson has no option but to defend
Rubel to Watson, 1 run a low full toss and Watson drives to long-off to keep strike
Razzak to Watson, SIX runs Watson equals the world record for most sixes in an innings by heaving the ball over long-on. That's his 12th and he draws level with Xavier Marshall.
Razzak to Watson, SIX runs and he's broken it. His 13th six. Again heaved over wide long-on. He takes the record for most sixes in an innings from Xavier Marshall. Bangladesh want this over with now
Razzak to Watson, no run Watson pulls and misses this time. Getting beaten outside off stump
Razzak to Watson, FOUR runs it's a disappointing four. Watson pulls with power into the gap between two people on the midwicket boundary
Razzak to Watson, no run Watson aims for another leg-side boundary and misses

Razzak to Watson, SIX runs yawn. Watson gets down on one knee, swings his bat with the power of a superhuman, and hits his 14th six, over midwicket again, with a slog sweep. This is getting stale now. How about a reverse-sweep for six?
Rubel to Ponting, 1 run Ponting drives straight down the ground for a single
Rubel to Watson, no run full ball outside off, Watson chops own on it and plays towards point
Rubel to Watson, FOUR runs full toss on middle and leg stump, Watson fails to hit his 15th, managing to swing it through square leg for a measly four.
Rubel to Watson, SIX runs well he's got his 15th!! This time with a cool swing through the line, lofting the ball straight over the fielder on the long-on boundary
Rubel to Watson, 1 run mis-hit through midwicket for a single
Rubel to Ponting, FOUR runs Ponting has his moment in Watson's sun, pulling the ball through backward square to score the winning runs. Bangladesh's torment is over.

That's it from us at ESPNcricinfo for the moment, join us day after tomorrow for the final game of this series. Did I mention that Australia have won it 2-0? I'm off to watch happy animated movies after this violence. Thank you for all your emails today. Cheers.
This is also the highest score by an Australian in an ODI. Beating Hayden's 181 against New Zealand.
Watson also scored the most runs in boundaries in an ODI innings. The previous record was Herschelle Gibbs's 126 runs in boundaries during his 175 in Johannesburg in 2006.
Australia won by 9 wickets (with 144 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Shane Watson, AUS
